page.title: 18DAIRY FARMING CONT
page.content: DAIRY FARMING - CONTD FROM PAGE 17 Dairy farms are highly mechanized and so don't need to employ many workers. Both farms we visited only employ 2 men. They are all local men travelling to work by bus, bike and car. On one of the farms they worked on average a 35 hour working week, while on the other the working week was 50 hours. As the working year on a dairy farm doesn't really vary they don't need to employ any extra workers. If anyone wanted to start up a farm in the district they would either have to be very wealthy as land price is generally around Â£1000+ per acre. The price depending upon the quality of the land. Or they could start off by renting a farm and gradually buying the farm over a period of time.
